meanings.definition: A large area of city land that is divided into blocks, often with limited access for vehicles.
meanings.sent1: The city planners decided to create superblocks to reduce traffic congestion.
meanings.sent2: The new neighborhood was designed with superblocks to make it easier for pedestrians to move around.
meanings.sent3: Why did the superblocks throw a party? Because they wanted to block off the streets!
meanings.sent4: The superblocks stood like giant puzzle pieces, fitting perfectly together to form the cityscape.
meanings.sent5: As I looked down from above, the superblocks resembled a colorful mosaic of urban planning.

meanings.definition: A group of city blocks that are combined to create a larger unit for urban planning purposes.
meanings.sent1: The architects proposed connecting the existing blocks to form superblocks for better city organization.
meanings.sent2: The city council approved the development of superblocks to revitalize the downtown area.
meanings.sent3: Why did the superblocks break up? Because they couldn't agree on the best layout!
meanings.sent4: The superblocks loomed over the city like interconnected giants, shaping the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The superblocks were like building blocks, coming together to form a cohesive urban structure.
